intro: Vataireopsis, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plants are typically small trees or shrubs, characterized by their compound leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. Vataireopsis species are often found in sandy or well-drained soils, thriving in open, sunny habitats. They play a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
